intro: Ribes bactonii, commonly known as the Bacton gooseberry, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the genus Ribes, which includes various species of flowering plants in the family Grossulariaceae. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow or orange berries that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
